intro: Microstylis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. It has slender, triangular stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
